a note on the dangling else in algol 60some revisions of algol 60 are proposed whichnot only eliminate certain ambiguous statements but also add some convenience to the language a discussionof the background of the problem and a sketch of a proof that the ambiguities have been removed is included.cacm august 1963kaupe jr a f.ca630837 jb march 13 1978 8:06 pm249 4 761254 4 761272 4 7611086 4 7611102 4 7611109 4 7611132 4 7611140 4 7611188 4 7611234 4 7611263 4 7611265 4 7611270 4 7611306 4 7611323 4 7611358 4 7611379 4 7611380 4 7611453 4 7611464 4 7611464 4 7611484 4 7611491 4 7611491 4 7611498 4 7611613 4 7611614 4 7611767 4 7611781 4 7611781 4 7611787 4 7611825 4 7611860 4 7611949 4 761321 4 7612059 4 7612083 4 7612126 4 7612178 4 7612179 4 7612252 4 7612325 4 7612341 4 7612546 4 761435 4 761437 4 761463 4 761483 4 761491 4 7612645 4 7612652 4 7612684 4 7612732 4 7612842 4 7612929 4 7612934 4 761560 4 761583 4 7613069 4 7613073 4 761627 4 761631 4 761632 4 761642 4 761644 4 761653 4 761669 4 761679 4 761680 4 761691 4 761761 4 761761 4 761761 4 761762 4 761763 4 761123 4 761140 4 761919 4 761949 4 761989 4 761989 4 761196 5 761947 5 7611379 5 7613184 5 761761 5 761761 5 761761 5 7611263 6 7611477 6 7613184 6 761669 6 761761 6 761
